movie_title: Octopuses and fish work together: BBC Learning English from the News
introduction: Scientist have found new underwater behaviour, including an octopus that works with fish and punches

vocabulary.definition: existing alone; not living or going with others
vocabulary.example: The writer enjoys the solitary life in the mountains, away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

vocabulary.definition: used in a way that is metaphorical; not literal
vocabulary.example: Her words were a metaphorical representation of her inner struggles.

vocabulary.definition: a fellow member of a team
vocabulary.example: She always supports her teammates during difficult matches.

vocabulary.definition: to cause someone to believe or feel certain; persuade
vocabulary.example: She tried to convince her parents to let her go on the trip by explaining its educational benefits.

vocabulary.definition: situated, occurring, or done beneath the surface of the water
vocabulary.example: The divers explored the underwater caves to discover hidden treasures.

vocabulary.definition: casual; suitable for everyday use, but not formal situations
vocabulary.example: The email was written in an informal tone, as they were friends and not colleagues.
